faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: This course will introduce several process mining techniques,  including techniques for automated process discovery, conformance checking, performance analysis, business rules mining, and predictive process monitoring. In order to develop a mastery of these techniques, we will introduce concrete tools and we will apply these tools to answer business questions using real-life datasets.

objectives.en: The objectives of this course are to get acquainted with the basic concepts and principles of process mining and learn how to use process mining techniques to identify opportunities to improve a business process.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on tutvuda protsessikaeve põhimõistetega, põhiprintsiipidega ning õppida läbi viima lihtsat praktilist projekti.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of this course, you will be able to:
- analyze business process event logs using process mining techniques;
learning_outcomes.et: analüüsida äriprotsessi sündmuslogisid kasutades protsessikaeve meetodeid;

learning_outcomes.en: - identify a suitable combination of process mining techniques to address a given business question;
learning_outcomes.et: valida sobivad protsessikaeve meetodid ärilistele küsimustele vastamiseks;

learning_outcomes.en: - use a process mining tool at an intermediate level;
- explain how to use process mining techniques in conjunction with other data mining and business process analysis techniques to improve a business process.
learning_outcomes.et: selgitada kuidas protsessikaeve tehnikaid kasutatakse koos teiste andmekaeve ja äriprotsessi analüüsi tehnikatega.

independent_work.et: Details about the homework exercises, the course project, and the final exam, will be published in both the course wiki (https://courses.cs.ut.ee/2025/pm/) and the course Moodle (https://moodle.ut.ee/course/view.php?id=13926)

description.et: A set of homework exercises corresponding to various topics taught throughout the course.
Course project to be completed in a team and to be presented during the last lecture of the teaching period. The team must also submit a project report before their oral presentation of the project.
Final exam consisting in the analysis of an event log using various process mining techniques, such as the ones studied throughout the course.

grade_preconditions.et: Participation in and submission of the course project is a requirement for attending the final assessment.

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade will correspond to the sum of:
- Homework: 25 points in total, distributed throughout the first three months of the semester.
- Project: 25 points in total, to be done during the last month of the semester.
- Final exam: 50 points (in-person, open-book, and open-laptop).

To pass the course, you must score at least 51 points in total AND at least 20 out of 50 points in the final exam.

mi.et: Submission of less than three homework exercises, no participation in the course project, and no attendance at the final exam.

debt_elimination.et: A resit exam will be offered to students who do not pass the course after the first examination.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
